website_summaries.verdict: Can accomplish multiple fitness goals with quality design and features not found elsewhere.
pros: Provides both lat pull-down equipment, deadlifts, and more, earning praise for its shape and extra comfort features, such as foam covers
cons: Extra resources may be needed to build the unit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Power Rack
customer_reviews.text: great rack. Took about 2 and a half hours to put it together , Having a socket set is recommended . Very sturdy and the lat attachment works great. I added some photos showing the process of putting it together , Hope it helps ;)
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Squat rack good, cable system horrible
customer_reviews.text: The squat rack itself is great, but the additional pulley system is horrible. It moves way too stiff as well the spindle that attaches to the pulley is cheap. I've actually had better results just buying a bunch of resistance bands attaching them together on some clips to various latches. I have a warranty, but to go out of my way to send it back, wait on a new one, reassemble it just isn't with the headache. Lesson learned: you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Trufitness617

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are true!
customer_reviews.text: YES! Got this beast when the price was $390. I would easily have paid double and most racks I have seen that are double are probably not this nice. It was easy to assemble and despite what other reviewers say, the cables are awesome and I did not do any of the modifications that some suggested. Take your time and put it together properly. Also I did not think the cable attachments were bad quality either. People just like to complain! I have not one bad thing to say about this rack and I can't believe I went without it for so long. I seriously never have to leave the house again :)
customer_reviews.author: currenakat

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Be careful not to over tighten bolts as frame will compress. Its 2/14/17 and the plastic coating on the cable is pretty much gone from the upper cable. Bottom cable still has coating so far but expect this to rub off at some point. Other than that, this rack is doing its job. I attached some photos for reference-not great but something. Update 2/17/17...so i noticed i routed the top cable wrong on top. Corrected this issue and no rubbing. Hence i now give 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: No regrets. Handles my 440 bench press
customer_reviews.text: This over all is a very good rack. It does get in its own way when you try to incline bench press. But it can be done. I bench press 440 one rep max inside the rack with know spotter and I feel confident in its ability to save me when I fail a rep. I am a carful lifter I do not slam weights. This rack works great for me it does shake a little but not an alarming amount. I will be adding some corner support to cut down on the shaking
customer_reviews.author: Brad Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this cage, Not sturdy at all !!
customer_reviews.text: Assessment after 2 weeks of use- Cage seems light for long-term use, is not sturdy at all, I can move the cage easily even when its loaded. Lat pull Cables have too much friction when moving on plastic pulleys, tried silicone oil already. The rectangular pipes bend when tightening the bolts/nuts during assembly speaking for sub-quality of material. Good for light exercises or kids play only. Cannot return now after assembly but will look for an upgrade soon (may be in 6 months). Do not recommend buying. Please do not repeat my mistake, invest now to buy better cage instead of upgrading in near term.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Great value for your money
customer_reviews.text: Great home gym cage with lots of functionality. My only complain is that the inside of the cage is pretty narrow. It feels especially narrower with stock barbell holders because they are pretty large. I replaced mine with some smaller J hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Cashsky

customer_reviews.title: ALL KINDS OF GAINS!
customer_reviews.text: & all kinds of money savings. This is a steal you must buy this. You have everything you need for a home gym here. I bought some dip bars and gymnastic rings for it. There's lots of room inside the cage and nothing of mine has broke. The cable seems to work just fine. The pull up bar could be at least 1/2 a foot taller but it will still suffice like this. I am 5'10 178 pounds and it's a great set for me. It will be for you too. It's sturdy and reliable. I've place 375 lbs on the safety bars and left them sitting the for days while gone on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: GU

customer_reviews.title: solid quality
customer_reviews.text: Great deal for the money. Enjoying it and using weekly - if I would redesign I would make the front weight bar perches slightly longer but its a minor point. Would give a bit more room for bench etc. My son and I have been using it and seems very sturdy with 250+ lbs and when doing pullups etc. Great unit
customer_reviews.author: Feydakin

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: This power rack was pretty easy to build with the right tools. For the price, you can't beat it. No parts have broken and we've used the crap out of this thing. My wife is an in home personal trainer that uses this machine for her clients. Not only does the gym look totally legit with this power rack, it is adjustable for a variety of clients. I looked at much more expensive power racks and don't regret this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Chapman

customer_reviews.title: The pulley system moves very smooth and fluid. It ...
customer_reviews.text: The pulley system moves very smooth and fluid. It took me two hours to put the whole thing together but that is probably because I was doing it by myself. My only complaint is the bar hooks allow the bar to roll forward.....which keeps scaring me each time I get under it to bench. =) Because it allows the bar to roll and sit forward on the hooks I am wondering what impact that may have on the life of the bar hooks (bending over time under the weight stress)
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack!! Use It Everyday
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our home gym in our garage and it's been great. No complaints, does basically everything you need it to do for power lifting. You can even set it up where you have one rack as your "spotter" safety level while doing bench press. I've had no problem doing pull-ups on it either. The only problem I've encountered is with the cable pulls... if you're too close to it and don't have enough weight on, it can get twisted a bit. But other than that, no complaints at all. This has been the best investment I've ever made. Use it everyday. All about home gyms!!!
customer_reviews.author: judy g

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic rack. I can now do bench presses and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic rack. I can now do bench presses and squats without having to worry that I may get stuck. I really like that lat attachment, however, it sort of get in the way of a spotter. I can probably do bench press outside the rack if I have a spotter but I think it is safer to do it inside as my spotter (my 13 yr old) is not strong enough if I really can't get that last rep up. Overall a great investment would recommend it to anyone interested in a power rack for their home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Wingster

customer_reviews.title: so much you feel like it is gonna rip your skin off
customer_reviews.text: the knarling on the pullup bar is way to much. so much you feel like it is gonna rip your skin off. So i was going to file it down but got lazy and put athletic tape over it instead. The one other thing that i dont like (But this is just a preference) is that the weight racks are 1" diameter so I had to buy adapter sleeves. Besides that it has been great so far. I will update if I have any problems like with the pulley wheels/bearings which I have heard some people have a problem with.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hiltbrunn

customer_reviews.title: Pull down cable isn't a flexible as I think it should be.
customer_reviews.text: Though I really like this cage, there is one thing I'm disappointment in that I wish I would have known before I bought it. When doing Cable Overhead Tricep Extensions, the cable rubs agains the edge of the cut where the pulley is located on top causing the cable to get damaged. I wish the cut out was longer and more open. However, this is a really good cage and I enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even a girl can put it together ;)
customer_reviews.text: For someone that's lives by herself and has never used a socket wrench in her life...I was able to put this together. Some hardware was missing but that was an easy fix. I just called the number on the manual and they shipped it out to me. Just having issues putting the hard plastic pieces on the pulley system. They make you take these pieces off in order to slide one pole over another and then putting them back on again is impossible. So I've yet to use that piece if the equipment. I know I'll figure it out. But it's doing the job for now and I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rack that you won't regret!
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack! It does everything you need it to. I use this 4x's a week and would purchase again in a heartbeat! Very adjustable, stable, and compact. Get a nice solid adjustable bench to go with it and you will be able to work most of your muscle groups. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Donald J. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Thank you VALOR!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and even better customer support, unfortunately the package was really beat from shipping due to the heavy pieces in the box. The box opened and I was missing quite a bit of hardware (bolts etc..) I contacted VALOR and they took care of me immediately and shipped out the missing parts. Solid product and amazing support! You won't get anything better for this price range, I still can't believe the price. This is quality equipment!
customer_reviews.author: wired

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: FOR THE PRICE this rack is 5 star perfect. I'm not a gym rat - I needed something for a beginner/intermediate lifter. I'm 6'2" 220lbs (when I bought it) and have no trouble with squats while inside the rack. Granted, it's a little tight in there but I have no trouble. It's a very solid rack, the lat attachment is great, everything works as expected. If I had to gripe, it would be about the small storage bars - I'll eventually buy some olympic adapters (although I'm not sure why...I don't really need them for storage).
customer_reviews.author: relevantslim

customer_reviews.title: Anything more and your wasting your money
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this rack for about eight months and have to say it was the best purchase I have ever made. I workout using this rack five days a week and can't say enough good thing about it. I powerlifted for year but after a few pretty bad injuries I have since lowered my weight but still go heavy by most people's standards and this rack holds up very well. The pully is smooth and I can't think of any exercises that I haven't been able to do on this. Get a bench a bar and some plates and get strong.
customer_reviews.author: justin bonaventure

customer_reviews.title: EVERYTHING YOU NEED FOR THE BEST PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I was debating on this cage over many others around the same price but I finally decided on this one bc it comes with the weight plate storgae, more holes than other cages and the knee anchor for lat pull downs.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Valor Power cage. the lat pulldown is very smooth, and Ed’s lots of variety to workouts. The cage it’s self is very sturdy and we all handle any amount of Weight this old guy will throw at it. I am very happy with this purchase and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lawler

customer_reviews.title: REALLY REALLY BAD!!
customer_reviews.text: REALLY REALLY BAD!!!!! WELDED WRONG, BENT ITEMS, MISSING PARTS!!!! SELLER WILL NOT STAND BEHIND PRODUCT! BAD PRODUCT, HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! I NOW HAVE A 400 PILE OF JUNK IN MY GYM!!! COMPLETE GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality considering the price.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is awesome... its the perfect value between quality and budget ... its ment for light commercial use which is exactly what i need it for. It holds up to 600lb on the hold up pins and holds over 800lb for the safety bars has 27 adjustable positions and is a great edition to my gym. You can spend triple the price of this rack on a commercial power rack basiclly waste your money... this does the job and had a lat pull attachment for shoulders,triceps,bicep workouts. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: So far this is something that I should have bought years ago. I'm 6'2" and there is plenty of room for my reach to the pulldown sitting on a bench. Plenty of room in the rack for squats. The box steel is thinner than a commercial gym rack but the safety bars and barbell hooks are solid and I feel very safe using the rack. I would feel safe going up to about 600# or so on the barbell. Overall if you are looking for a rack you can do a full body workout with at a fair price, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Comes with lat pull-down bar and a non-rotating straight bar about 16-18 in long. Took an hour or two to put together by myself. The metal frame is a little thin, be careful not to over-tighten the bolts. I warped the metal a little. I use this daily and have no complaints. I also have a bowflex 1090 dumbbell set, Olympic bar and weights, and various attachments. For about $1400 total, I have everything I need for pretty versatile workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasently surprised. Easy to put together and very, very solid once assembled. My only complaint is that I wish the interior of the cage was longer from front to back if you have the cable set up attached. I weigh about 204 and the cage does not budge while doing pull ups. Cables are smooth and the preacher attachment works well. I am glad I bought it. It does it all. Who needs a gym if you have one of these and a decent adjustable bench, dumbells and olympic weights!!
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Valor is top quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! Exactly what I had hoped for. Pulley is smooth. Easy assembly. Was missing 4 rubber feet for base, but customer service rectified quickly, without hesitation. Was undecided between this cage and a different brand. Deciding factor was Valor reputation and lat pulldown crossbar (to keep me seated). Did not disappoint in the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: DMB

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it at the price and then some. Fairly easy to assemble, sturdy enough for most garage lifters (less than 500lbs on a given lift), and plenty of room for most people. I'm 6' 2" and can do everything, but overhead lifts inside the cage. Pulley system works well, but cables can always be an issue down the line. Would recommend to anyone looking to get more serious about lifting at home.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W Doherty

customer_reviews.title: ... limited space in my basement and this unit works fine. I am not big ( 5'10'
customer_reviews.text: I have limited space in my basement and this unit works fine. I am not big ( 5'10', 215lbs.). You cannot do the bench press inside the cage as there isn't room for the bench (at least the way I work out) and squats are a little tight. The lat pull was the reason I bought this unit as the price was below any half rack or other power cage I found on Amazon. I can do pull ups by keeping my head in-between the floor joists.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weightlifting rack
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent weightlifting rack! The rack is solid (i.e., does not sway) when doing pull-ups and dips (The dip bars must be purchased separately but are well worth having), and easily handles the 300lb Olympic barbell set I have. Unlike many home weightlifting gym racks, the pulley on this power rack works very well. I am very pleased with this power rack and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: MPC

customer_reviews.title: Great solid rack
customer_reviews.text: Great solid rack. It was easy to put together. It feels strong and like it will be durable. The plate pegs sit a little bit high and I bump them when I'm coming down on bench. I solve this by removing the plates when I'm benching. It'd be better if the plate pegs sat somewhere else. I'm not sure if it's the size of plates I'm using or the height of my bench but it happens every time.
customer_reviews.author: yesi

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang For Your Buck!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this rack is absolutely perfect. The price to quality ratio makes this an amazing value. Nothing is useless, I thought the foam bar would be, but I use it all the time. Another surprise is the stickers that come with it for lining up the holes. Stickers don't seem like a big deal, I know, but the point is this rack is great down to the details.
customer_reviews.author: Arianna S

customer_reviews.title: Excellant home gym addition
customer_reviews.text: I am real happy with all of Valor fitness products The pulley system on this is very smooth. It allows me to enjoy my workouts even more the price is reasonabbe too Do yourself a favor and get it.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is–a cage. It's inexpensive and no frills. It's not pretty, it's a hunk of metal. There is nothing as good as this in this price range. There are better, but they cost well over $1000. Using it I find it slightly cramped on the inside, but totally workable. It you are very tall it might not be spacious enough for you for squats. The lat/cable action was surprisingly smooth.
customer_reviews.author: MDOM

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's been a year and a half now, and I still love my workout rack. It's sturdy and durable and I'd absolutely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: So far I like this power rack
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this power rack. For the price and what they provide seems reasonable. The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is that I don't like the 1 inch diameter plate holders for the lat pull attachment which is for standard weight plates and not Olympic plates. I think you can order 2 inch diameter sleeves from Valor that could work so it can fit the Olympic plates. Overall not a bad piece of equipment and hopefully it holds up long term.
customer_reviews.author: GregB.

customer_reviews.title: More bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, completely eliminated my need for a gym. Shipped out and got to my house in less than a week. It took me about 4 hours to put it together, and was slightly challenging doing it by myself. Suggest you have someone help. Just finished my first workout with it, and I'm truly amazed at how smooth the cables were. Should have bought one years ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Assembly is a little time consuming and you will want to use your own wrenches. Over all this does exactly what you want it to do.
customer_reviews.author: James Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Solid! Not difficult to assemble for someone with medium shop skills. Directions were a bit week, and the pulley system in the package was different then the directions indicated. However, I figured it out, And I have been using it, successfully every week for the past year. I love having a full service gym right in the convenience of my basement.
customer_reviews.author: J.P. Cogburn

customer_reviews.title: Very great rack for everything that it has
customer_reviews.text: Very great rack for everything that it has. I haven't had any problems with the lat tower or pulleys, but will keep an eye on them. It went together very easily and did not take long. I used my impact driver to speed through it...just don't over tighten.
customer_reviews.author: Street 5.0

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home gym
customer_reviews.text: Wow wow. Enjoying so much. Cancelled membership at gym and seeing much GAINZ! also purchased cable crossover for rack also by valor. Friends and family are noticing the muscle I am putting on. No more waiting for a work station at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS RACK
customer_reviews.text: Love this rack. Well worth every penny I spent on it. I actually just purchased the cross over attachment that allows you to do a lot more exercises. The only thing I would like to see different is for Valor to number the holes on each vertical leg for easier recognition. Otherwise, there isn't any thing else I could find wrong with this.
customer_reviews.author: Black Belt319

customer_reviews.title: perfect for home gym
customer_reviews.text: The top plate holder gets in the way of squat and bench so i had to remove it. The pulley system is nice but be aware that you will not be able to put the legs of a bench behind the rack. So with some benches you will not be able to do incline bench or shoulder presses inside rack. You will also not be able to have a spotter behind you. Otherwise its great and worth it to be able to do various excercises with the pully.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: wicked power cage!
customer_reviews.text: Great rack, very sturdy construction, the lat & low pulley system was the selling point for me. Plus comes with lat bar and small straight bar. Was impressed with the quality of the unit for the money. 4 weight plate storage pegs is a great selling point too. I assembled it in a little over an hour. You can do squats inside the cage or outside of it, plenty of weight pins and the safety bars make it great if you are lifting alone. Wonderful peice of equipment, highly recommend it. Great price, free shipping , cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Mattasales

customer_reviews.title: SOLID!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this rack since Oct 2015. LOTS of reps. and heavy weights on this rack.I tell you THIS rack and the lat. attachment is SOLID!!!! Anchored it to the garage floor and wall. Very easy to assemble about 1 to1.5 hours at the most.
customer_reviews.author: JOE

customer_reviews.title: Not that great but it works
customer_reviews.text: I feel like for the amount of money just for this rack is not really worth it. The rack is too wobbly for my liking. Yes I installed everything correctly. It holds all the weight I can lift it just makes me feel uneasy. Also it needs to be taller. I'm not even able to perform standing cable triceps extensions. I'd rather pay for a gym membership if I was able to.
customer_reviews.author: John Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Power Rack Perfect for ALL Needs.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need it to and more. Adjustable bars for Squatting, benching or shoulder pressing, Pulley system is very smooth and holds the weight extremely well and is useful for multiple workouts, Pull up bar holds well. Only down side is if you need the safety bars low, (where the weight plate holders are) it wont go all the way through, but with multiple slots to choose from and the ability to remove if needed it is not an issue. I bought a bench to sit and lay and it makes easier to use the pulleys.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: great investment
customer_reviews.text: Pretty big investment for me, but this thing has been great. Get a friend to help you build it, goes much faster. Had for about 9 months now, and I definitely work out more than I ever have.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Towle

customer_reviews.title: Overall good rack... Subpar packaging
customer_reviews.text: Just received this rack. Overall good reviews. Sturdy, fairly easy to put together & does what it says it does. Packaging was sub par. Most of the hardware was not packaged & lose in the box. It came with the empty opened packaging where the hardware once was. Kinda sketchy. This caused a little confusion matching up the size & has me thinking that it was used or previously assembled. Ended up being short on a few nuts for the pully system. Not that big of a deal since I was able to purchase them at an everyday hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about a week so far and love it. I'm very glad I purchased this. I was going to go with a much more expensive rack but this cut the bill in half and offered the same thing I was looking for. I do think a little bit more than 2 feet is needed to feel comfortable in it, as it just feels like a tight fit, but I'm sure i'll get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: H.V.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good rack
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good rack. Pulley system is fantastic - except I had to modify mine. The top pulley hole isn't long enough to use for Taller people who stand back more. The cable rubs against the metal if you don't cut it. Besides that, this thing rocks. Added a landmine to it too
customer_reviews.author: DiablisOegnus

customer_reviews.title: Very wobbly. The chin up bar is very short ...
customer_reviews.text: Very wobbly. The chin up bar is very short and thing if your 6 ft tall or more. The smoothness is about what you would expect with plate loaded cable work. The cables coating pulled off in one section in a couple months. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Already, this rack has become integral in my exercise program. Pulley system works very well, and rack is solid. For this price, you will not find a better piece of exercise equipment. Delivery was in two large well wrapped boxes. Each piece in the box was also individually wrapped. Hardware was in shrink wrapped package that pretty well insures you have what you need to build. Went together quickly, and without trouble. Would recommend this to anyone, both beginner and serious weight lifters.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Hibbets

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Product.  Very Solid and Large enough for me, 6'5" 230lbs.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build, took about two hours or less. No missing parts. The Lat Pulldown is very smooth, no issues at all with it. I shot it with a little silicon spray from 3M before even trying it and it's great. Very smooth operation, pulley system is very solid. I'm 6'5" tall and I have no issues with the size, it's big enough for me. Squats are fine, not tight. It's large enough to feel solid and give me the room I need, but small enough to fit in my house. I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lane

customer_reviews.title: Amazing LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Amazing LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! Don't even need a cable machine now because this has a hi/low pulley. Great for tricep rope pull downs,one armed lat pulls,lat pull down,etc...lower is good for glute kick backs,biceps bar curls, lawn mowers,etc..LOVE THIS PRODUCT wish I had ordered this for my gym sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: This power rack has everything for such a great price. I have owned the BD-7 for 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: This power rack has everything for such a great price. I have owned the BD-7 for 3 weeks, and I can say that I love it. It is very sturdy even when doing pull ups. The lat row works great and is smooth. My only criticism is that the distance front to back is small. So it feels like there is little room when squatting. This however is one of the reasons I bought this rack as I do not have much room.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great workout cage
customer_reviews.text: Great workout cage. Very stable and good quality. It only took me about 2.5 hrs to put together. You must use a ratchet took in order to put it together. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great home system!!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had my rack now for just over a year.....well worth it. I’ve put this rack through the ringer...banging it around, putting some serious weight it, and it’s still standing strong. My only complaint would be when using the lower cable with heavier weight, the rack will tend to slide. Other than that great rack, I just ordered the dip bars today.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toombs

customer_reviews.title: Great Cage
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. The pulley attachment is not an issue if you install it correctly. I’m 6’5” and have no problem doing squats. You can’t beat this cage, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: K.E.

customer_reviews.title: a bit narrow but it does what i need. ...
customer_reviews.text: a bit narrow but it does what i need. I don't keep weights on the side pegs. If you did you wont be able to bench press without hitting them
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: BD-MEH shaky shaky
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, but it's pretty shaky and doesn't look great. Despite being twice the cost I wish I would've gone with the titan rack.
customer_reviews.author: J. smith

customer_reviews.title: This thing is totally boss! It's a little wobbly ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is totally boss! It's a little wobbly if you push against it but I don't feel any danger while working out. Tons of exercises. Holds quite a bit of weight, but I wish it held Olympic weights.
customer_reviews.author: Corey V.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The power rack is well built and easy to assemble. I am 6'2" and have plenty of room to do what I need to. The only thing that remains to be seen is how long the pulley system lasts. Very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Weaver

customer_reviews.title: It is great to have the lateral pull attachment as well
customer_reviews.text: Rack is solid, and appropriate for home use. It is great to have the lateral pull attachment as well! The pegs are a little shaky, but will not drop the bar. Overall, a good quality piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: mynomadlyfe

customer_reviews.title: I fell in love with this the first day I started using it ...
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with this the first day I started using it and have used it everyday since then. You can do so many exercises with it I love it and would recommend it to anyone looking for something like this. I have not had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Krystle P.

customer_reviews.title: The rack seems good enough, but arrived missing pieces (all four black ...
customer_reviews.text: The rack seems good enough, but arrived missing pieces (all four black plastic caps for the base). I have contacted the seller to request they replace the missing pieces, so we'll see what happens. Also, no assembly instructions are included in the package, which isn't too big of a deal, as assembly is pretty straight-forward. I must admit that I'm a little irritated the package is missing parts, but as long as the seller takes appropriate action, I will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy bliss

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy rack, I like the lat attachment
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy rack, I like the lat attachment. Cable rows on the floor are taking time to get used to, but very smooth on the pulldown.
customer_reviews.author: Shonda Borden

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my home gym
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy! I have several attachments and can use this for a ton of different exercises. This setup is a phenomenal deal and will easily last several years. Without question a worthy investment.
customer_reviews.author: cfitz

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together. I had it together in less than 2 hours by myself. Pretty solid rack overall. I have only used it once and it handled 300 pounds no problem. The pulley system worked well, but the pulleys seem cheap and the plastic hubs seem a little suspect but time will tell if they last. Overall I’m happy with it and would recommend it to just about anyone for there home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The pulley system broke down with little use, manufacturer replaced under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love this cage for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this cage for the price. Only few things I wish were different would be holes along the bottom to attach bands, a bent/more ergonomic pullup bar, somewhere to attach a t-row hookup.
customer_reviews.author: 2kanchoo

customer_reviews.title: Buy It.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Had it for a while now and it has held up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan O.

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great product for us. We've had it and used it regularly for over 2 years. We had a slight problem with a piece that was damaged when it arrived but it was handled quickly and professionally. Really good, solid, durable rack.
customer_reviews.author: staciefm

customer_reviews.title: BEST FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: In this price range you can't beat it. Handles 400+ pounds with ease. Optional dip bars are great. I experienced no problems with the seller or shipment. It was delivered within a week.
customer_reviews.author: C_F_P

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: As with everything I have gotten from Valor it is sturdy, and performs as advertised all while being affordably priced! Only complaint is the Cage is a little narrow to work in when you have plates hanging on the plate holders, on some excercises I end up smaking them with the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VALOR Gets FIVE STARS
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for Valor Fitness. This rack system is awesome! Easy to put together. Customer service is amazing too. We gave it 4 stars because fed ex lost box one of two package. The shipping company did not get an answer to me for a week. BUT when I called VALOR directly, my missing box was shipped within a week. Valor returns phone calls and gets answers. One pulley was damaged when I opened the box, and Valor shipped it to me in two days. Overall we love this rack system! We are excited to be using this gym equipment in our home. The price was just right too. If you have any issues, call Valor- their customer service ROCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Amazing rack exactly as described very sturdy easy to put together and for the price you can't find anything anywhere near as good as this product. Extremely fast shipping great seller. Couldn't be happier with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Cody Strathman

customer_reviews.title: Love all the new workouts it provides
customer_reviews.text: This was an anniversary present for my husband, but it is something we both use. So many more options than just the regular bench. Love all the new workouts it provides. Super easy to put together, all parts were with it. Best buy ever!
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my husband wanted for Christmas. he said it wasn't too hard to put together and does everything he was looking for and more.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Surprising quality at a very good price. If you are moving major weight (245 ...
customer_reviews.text: Surprising quality at a very good price. If you are moving major weight (245 lbs bench) or consistently loading this thing with 250 LBS Id suggest a stronger power rack. But for my purposes it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5 feet 4 inches tall and this power rack ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5 feet 4 inches tall and this power rack seems to be just the right size. Not too big and not too small, however I think if I was any taller this would be too small for someone else. The assembly took about 2 hrs but other that I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the bd7 power cage. It is well engineered and built. It took about two hours alone to assemble taking my time. I firmly believe this is the best value for the money on the market in power cages. It is the perfect cage for the home gym. The lat attachment is functional for pull downs and rows but the mechanism does seem to create a little friction and more resistance than a institutional lat machine. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: we love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to our home gym. It allows us to lift heavy without injury. I adore the lat bar. A well built and cost efficient piece of machinery. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Seattlerain

customer_reviews.title: Best home workout equipment I've ever used my home gym ...
customer_reviews.text: Best home workout equipment I've ever used my home gym is full of valor Athletics Inc products and they work great very good and sturdy material.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD CRESPO

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, solid rack. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly with two people. Solid and stable. Lat pull and low row are suprisingly smooth and the leg bar is such a good feature that I'm glad was included. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hillyer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this rack
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this rack. I give it 5 stars as compared to the price. It has some cheapness to it but overall I am very happy for what I got for the money I spent
customer_reviews.author: Michele Pickney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it. You can do just about any work out with it
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT buy. You will NOT regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal home gym. Pulleys are great, not having to switch cables to use top and bottom is the s***. It's Heavy duty and well constructed. But easy enough to assemble/disassemble. Putting it together was a breeze. Descriptive instructions, nuts/bolts/washers/ all packeged great. Well worth the money. Plenty of room in the rack for squats. You feel safe in it.
customer_reviews.author: Kly Ebz

customer_reviews.title: I like it. It works well for me
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It works well for me, and was not difficult to put together; however, if you are extremely into lifting, this may not be for you. It seems structurally sound, but I question how much weight it can really take. Either way, great piece of equipment for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim E. Varouhas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome power rack
customer_reviews.text: Seller got me the item five days faster then the estimate, would give the seller himself five stars. Awesome rack, does everything I want it too. The directions were a bit over simplified, it parses all the steps into four macro steps, where the lines overlap and it takes some organization to get it together, but I was able to build it solo. The only thing I don't like is the chin up bar grip is a bit to abrasive, way more so than the grips on an Olympic bar so I'm going to need to mask over it somehow because I lift barehanded.
customer_reviews.author: james zetes

customer_reviews.title: After using it for about a month now, I have no complaints. The pulley system works very smooth.
customer_reviews.text: Just finished putting my BD-7 power rack together. As far as structure, it looks very strong and sturdy. Really like the accessories that come with it.It was not hard to assemble at all. I look forward to using it. Ill update and provide another review after giving it a try for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Home Gym!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this cage! It doesn't rock, I fit in it perfectly (5'10" female) and I can do SO many different workouts with it! My husband assembled it alone and it took him approximately 90 minutes. He said it was easy and there were no issues with the pieces. This was the perfect addition to my home gym :)
customer_reviews.author: Kara Wahler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My son is so happy with this purchase. It's a very nice quality rack that was fairly easy to assemble. We would definitely recommend this to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: Judi

customer_reviews.title: Great Rack, Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine assembled and I'm very impressed with the quality and sturdiness of the rack. Took about and hour and a half to build alone. The directions were very easy to follow. Having the Lat pull is a huge plus! Can't beat the price for everything you get! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Very sturdy. Lat pull-down works very smoothly. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David Vermette

customer_reviews.title: Effective and good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, note the weights required for pull down device are standard not olympic.
customer_reviews.author: Terry G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this rack for the price. Took a little more than an hour to put together by myself. Had it for a month now & it has not disappointed. Use it about 3-4 times a week. Perfect size for me(5'10",200lb.). Lat tower is an added bonus
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Vanover

customer_reviews.title: Coating on the cables wore off after about two months ...
customer_reviews.text: Coating on the cables wore off after about two months of use. Got replacement cables and the coating wore off on the second set and with only twenty five pounds of weight on it. No more help after that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Grimsley

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together if you follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together if you follow the instructions! (oops!) Read everything first before trying to throw it together, this isn't IKEA. The one issue I had was that two of the holes in one of the vertical beams didn't line up with each other for a crossbeam to bolt onto. I widened it a little with a drill and got it to fit. Other than that, no issues and has performed well!
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

product_meta.title: Valor Fitness BD-7 Power Rack - Squat Rack and Bench Press Power Cage with LAT Pulldown Attachment and Other Workout Rack Bundle Options for a Complete Weightlifting Home Gym
feature_bullets: HEAVY DUTY- Constructed of 2” x 2” 12-gauge steel. Rubber base caps encase each foot to add safety, stability, and floor protection. This power rack is a must have weightlifting gift to give as the perfect addition to a new home gym.
VERSATILE- Includes a pull up station with knurled grip at the top of the rack, in addition to the lat pull down station with plate loading carriage (lap bar and low row/curl bar included).
ADJUSTABLE- 27 variable positions for bar support, ranging in height from 17.5” to 68”. Vibrant numbering system to easily identify variable positions.
STORAGE PEGS- Allows for an organized home gym with 4 plate storage pegs measuring 8” each for ample storage for both Olympic and standard plates.

ADDITIONAL- 500 lb. max load if using the bar catchers outside of the cage, 650 lb. max load if using the bar catchers inside the cage, 800 lb. max load for safety bars. 250lb. max load on the Lat Pull. For longer wear and tear, gently return the carriage to the starting position. Warranty, 3-year frame, 2-year cable, and 1-year hardware. Arrives in 2 separate boxes. Get him the best gift to start off his new year right.
